snippet: “The Double Life of Paul de Man,” by Evelyn Barish, is the first full biography of the Yale literary theorist who helped turn deconstruction into an insurgent force in American intellectual life.
abstract: Book The Double Life of Paul de Man, Evelyn Barish's biography of Yale literary theorist who was accused after his death in 1980s of Nazi sympathies, threatens to reopen debate over his legacy; biography weaves together old and new charges to paint de Man as swindler, forger and bigamist, as well as anti-Semite.
lead_paragraph: “The Double Life of Paul de Man,” by Evelyn Barish, is the first full biography of the Yale literary theorist who helped turn deconstruction into an insurgent force in American intellectual life.
